title: 111_hr5333
content: The "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" is a Department of Defense recognition for dependent children of armed forces members. The "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" establishes a lapel button for eligible children of active duty armed forces members. The button is designed by the Secretary of Defense and can be requested through an application process. The "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" establishes a lapel button for eligible children of active duty armed forces members. Upon application and payment of a fee, the Secretary concerned presents a commemorative lapel button to eligible child dependents. The cost of the button covers manufacturing and distribution. Each eligible child dependent can receive only one button, even if they have multiple military member parents. The "Children of Military Service Members Commemorative Lapel Pin Act" allows eligible child dependents of active duty armed forces members to receive a lapel button. If a lapel button is lost or damaged without fault, it can be replaced by the Secretary concerned upon application and payment. An eligible child dependent is defined as a dependent of a member of the armed forces as described in specific sections. The Secretary of Defense will issue regulations to implement the provisions for eligible child dependents of active duty armed forces members. The regulations will be uniform across all armed forces to the extent possible. The Secretary of Defense will expedite the design, manufacture, and issuance of a commemorative lapel button for children of military service members. Retroactively, the button will be made available to eligible child dependents of active duty armed forces members. The Secretary of Defense will provide a mechanism for eligible individuals to apply for a children of military service members commemorative lapel button. The Secretary of Defense allows individuals to apply for a children of military service members commemorative lapel button. Members of the Armed Forces who served on active duty for over 30 days since September 11, 2001, will be notified about the button's availability. Applications must be submitted within one year to the Secretary of Defense. The subsection must be submitted to the Secretary of Defense within one year of announcing the availability of the lapel button. Costs, limitations, and exceptions from section 1126a of title 10, United States Code, apply to the presentation of the commemorative lapel button for children of military service members.
